column4: Achaogen's lead antibiotic succeeds two key studies; shares soar
column5: Achaogen Inc's lead antibiotic was successful in two key studies  spurring the company to proceed with regulatory submissions in the United States and Europe  and shares soared 76 percent to their highest in more than a year and half.

column4: Alexion Pharmaceuticals says CEO  CFO resign  shares slump
column5: Alexion Pharmaceuticals Inc's chief executive officer and chief financial officer resigned  a month after the drugmaker said it was investigating allegations related to sales practices of its flagship drug.

column4: U.S. top court rejects trade group's challenge to Colorado tax
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday left in place a Colorado law dubbed the "Amazon tax" designed to make it easier for the state to collect sales taxes on out-of-state internet purchases  refusing to hear a challenge to it by an industry trade group.

column4: Apple in talks to invest $1 billion in SoftBank tech fund: source
column5: Apple Inc  has held talks to invest up to $1 billion in a new $100 billion tech fund being set up by Japan's SoftBank Group Corp   a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday.

column2: Barclays Inverse US Treasury Composite ETN
column4: Private equity firm AnaCap to buy Barclays' French retail banking business
column5: PARIS Private equity firm AnaCap Financial Partners said on Monday it had signed an agreement with Barclays  to acquire its French retail banking business after the bank completed consultations with employees.

column4: JetBlue expects fourth-quarter unit revenue to fall between 1-2 percent
column5: JetBlue Airways Corp  said it expected fourth quarter unit revenue  which compares sales to how many seats the airline flies and how far it flies them  to fall between one and two percent.

column4: Tesla settles Norway lawsuit over car's performance
column5: OSLO Electric carmaker Tesla Motors Inc  has reached an out-of-court settlement with 126 Norwegian customers who claimed their cars' performance did not match promises made in the firm's marketing.

column4: Britain's Labour to ask urgent parliamentary question on Fox bid for Sky
column5: LONDON Britain's main opposition Labour Party will ask an urgent question in parliament on Monday about the proposed bid by Rupert Murdoch's Twenty-First Century Fox  for pay-TV company Sky   the parliamentary website said.

column4: Major Sky shareholder to vote against Fox bid
column5: LONDON A major shareholder in British pay-TV company Sky  will vote against Twenty-First Century Fox's  $14 billion takeover bid  the investor told Reuters on Sunday  while another said it is unhappy about the offer.

column4: UK PM May's spokeswoman says not appropriate to comment on Fox bid for Sky
column5: LONDON British Prime Minister Theresa May is aware of Rupert Murdoch's Twenty-First Century Fox  $14 billion takeover bid for British pay-TV company Sky Plc  but it would not be appropriate to comment on the deal  her spokeswoman said on Monday.

column4: Britain's Labour to ask urgent parliamentary question on Fox bid for Sky
column5: LONDON Britain's main opposition Labour Party will ask an urgent question in parliament on Monday about the proposed bid by Rupert Murdoch's Twenty-First Century Fox  for pay-TV company Sky   the parliamentary website said.

column4: Major Sky shareholder to vote against Fox bid
column5: LONDON A major shareholder in British pay-TV company Sky  will vote against Twenty-First Century Fox's  $14 billion takeover bid  the investor told Reuters on Sunday  while another said it is unhappy about the offer.

column4: UK PM May's spokeswoman says not appropriate to comment on Fox bid for Sky
column5: LONDON British Prime Minister Theresa May is aware of Rupert Murdoch's Twenty-First Century Fox  $14 billion takeover bid for British pay-TV company Sky Plc  but it would not be appropriate to comment on the deal  her spokeswoman said on Monday.

column4: Sumner Redstone and daughter pull CBS  Viacom merger plan
column5: NEW YORK Media mogul Sumner Redstone and his daughter Shari called off their failed effort to merge CBS Corp  and Viacom Inc  on Monday  sending shares of Viacom - widely viewed as the weaker company - down almost 8 percent. | Video

column4: Shari Redstone withdraws support for CBS-Viacom merger: CNBC
column5: Shari Redstone  vice chair of Viacom Inc and the daughter of controlling shareholder Sumner Redstone  has withdrawn her support for a merger between CBS Corp and Viacom  CNBC reported on Monday.

column4: Sumner Redstone and daughter pull CBS  Viacom merger plan
column5: NEW YORK Media mogul Sumner Redstone and his daughter Shari called off their failed effort to merge CBS Corp  and Viacom Inc  on Monday  sending shares of Viacom - widely viewed as the weaker company - down almost 8 percent. | Video

column4: Shari Redstone withdraws support for CBS-Viacom merger: CNBC
column5: Shari Redstone  vice chair of Viacom Inc and the daughter of controlling shareholder Sumner Redstone  has withdrawn her support for a merger between CBS Corp and Viacom  CNBC reported on Monday.

column4: U.S. seeks to undercut Aetna CEO's defense in merger fight
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. Justice Department sought on Monday to knock down arguments by Aetna Inc's  chief executive that Medicare Advantage competes with government insurance programs  making Aetna's proposed merger with Humana legal under antitrust law. Aetna CEO Mark Bertolini testified on Friday and returned to the witness stand Monday morning. The Justice Department sued to stop the merger in July.

column4: U.S. Supreme Court rejects AIG ex-CEO Hank Greenberg's appeal
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday rejected former American International Group CEO Maurice "Hank" Greenberg's bid to escape civil fraud charges in New York accusing him of orchestrating sham transactions at the insurer.

column4: Private equity firm AnaCap to buy Barclays' French retail banking business
column5: PARIS Private equity firm AnaCap Financial Partners said on Monday it had signed an agreement with Barclays  to acquire its French retail banking business after the bank completed consultations with employees.

column4: BlackRock warns of bond market 'pain' in the coming months
column5: NEW YORK BlackRock Inc cut its view on the outlook for U.S. Treasuries further in a publication distributed on Monday  warning investors to prepare for "pain."

column4: After explosive growth  bond ETFs brace for the next big test
column5: LONDON A wild ride for bond markets since the U.S. election has re-ignited concern about a liquidity crunch in parts of the exchange-traded funds market  home to a small but fast-growing slice of global assets.

column4: Boeing 777 production rate cut reflects steep sales drop
column5: SEATTLE Boeing Co  said on Monday that it will cut production of its twin-aisle 777 jetliner to five a month in August 2017  a 40 percent reduction from the current rate of 8.3 a month.

column4: Sumner Redstone and daughter pull CBS  Viacom merger plan
column5: NEW YORK Media mogul Sumner Redstone and his daughter Shari called off their failed effort to merge CBS Corp  and Viacom Inc  on Monday  sending shares of Viacom - widely viewed as the weaker company - down almost 8 percent. | Video

column4: Shari Redstone withdraws support for CBS-Viacom merger: CNBC
column5: Shari Redstone  vice chair of Viacom Inc and the daughter of controlling shareholder Sumner Redstone  has withdrawn her support for a merger between CBS Corp and Viacom  CNBC reported on Monday.

column4: Chipotle founder Ells takes over as sole CEO at burrito chain
column5: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc said founder Steve Ells will retake the helm as sole chief executive officer after co-CEO Monty Moran stepped down on Monday amid intense pressure to turn around the burrito chain which has struggled to recover from a string of food safety lapses that have damaged its sales and reputation.

column4: Eni spreads Egypt gas field risk with Rosneft stake sale
column5: MILAN Italian energy company Eni will sell a 30 percent stake in its giant Egyptian offshore gas field Zohr to Russia's Rosneft for $1.575 billion  pressing ahead with asset sales to fund investments and offset weak oil prices.

column4: Exxon's financial metrics mixed during Tillerson's decade as CEO
column5: HOUSTON As the front-runner for U.S. secretary of state  Exxon Mobil Corp  Chief Executive Rex Tillerson would bring a global business savvy seldom seen in a Cabinet member  let alone the country's top diplomat.

column4: Tillerson choice raises questions of corporate vs. national interest
column5: WASHINGTON The central question facing Exxon Mobil Corp  Chief Executive Rex Tillerson if he becomes U.S. secretary of state is whether a lifelong oil man with close ties to Russia can pivot from advancing corporate interests to serving the national interest.

column4: Goldman sees 'bullish' environment for copper through 1H17
column5: Changes in the outlook for copper's supply-demand balances that drove a recent rally in prices support a more "bullish" environment for the metal at least to mid-2017  Goldman Sachs said in note.

column4: Goldman's Cohn to accept key economic post: CNBC
column5: Goldman Sachs Group Inc's  President and Chief Operating Officer Gary Cohn will shortly accept the post to head the National Economic Council (NEC)  CNBC reported  citing a source.

column4: Oil output cut deal aimed at inventories  not just raising prices: Goldman Sachs
column5: Goldman Sachs said the formal agreement by non-OPEC oil producers this weekend in Vienna to help curb output was reached with a goal of "normalization" of inventories and not necessarily just at raising oil prices.

column4: Japan's Honda ties up with ride-hailing service Grab
column5: SINGAPORE Southeast Asian ride-hailing service Grab disclosed on Monday that Japan's Honda Motor Co had invested in the firm  as part of a $750 million funding announced previously  to collaborate on motorbike-hailing services.

column4: U.S. seeks to undercut Aetna CEO's defense in merger fight
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. Justice Department sought on Monday to knock down arguments by Aetna Inc's  chief executive that Medicare Advantage competes with government insurance programs  making Aetna's proposed merger with Humana legal under antitrust law. Aetna CEO Mark Bertolini testified on Friday and returned to the witness stand Monday morning. The Justice Department sued to stop the merger in July.

column4: Philips to sell Lumileds stake to U.S. investor Apollo for $1.5 billion
column5: AMSTERDAM Philips  will sell an 80.1 percent stake in Lumileds  its LED components and car lighting business  to U.S. investor Apollo  receiving $1.5 billion in cash  it said on Monday.

column4: Canada  cool on the F-35  says Lockheed jet still an option
column5: OTTAWA Canada will still consider Lockheed Martin Inc's  F-35 in an open competition for fighter jets  Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Monday  despite domestic and foreign criticism about the program's cost.

column4: Exclusive: McCain backs Trump criticism of F-35  says president can't cancel it
column5: WASHINGTON U.S. Senate Armed Services Committee Chairman John McCain said on Monday he backed President-elect Donald Trump’s criticism of the costs of Lockheed Martin’s F-35 fighter jet program  but said a president does not have the authority to cancel it because funds have already been appropriated.

column4: Data Dive: Lockheed falls victim to the Trump Tweet Factor
column5: Trump Tweet Factor: A company's stock move after it becomes the target of the President-elect's often bilious policy musings over Twitter. The pattern  so far  seems to repeat itself in a fairly consistent way: President-Elect attacks on Twitter; investors jump ship to varying degrees; and then reasonable thought (or wishful thinking) returns and everything seems to revert to something like normal.

column4: Morgan Stanley opens book for Tata Motors' shares worth up to $371 million: termsheet
column5: MUMBAI Morgan Stanley has started the process for an undisclosed buyer to for up to 50 million shares of Tata Motors Ltd  from the market in a potential 24.99 billion-rupee ($370.8 million) deal  according to a termsheet seen by Reuters on Monday.

column4: Hedge fund offers to buy NorthStar Realty Europe
column5: A major shareholder of NorthStar Realty Europe Corp  has offered to buy the company for $13 per share and is demanding that the real estate investment trust (REIT) pursue a new asset management contract  according to a letter seen by Reuters.

column4: Novartis eye drug franchise hit by failed Fovista studies
column5: ZURICH Novartis's bid to bolster its eye drug portfolio suffered a setback on Monday when it announced combining Lucentis with Fovista in patients with neovascular age-related macular degeneration (nAMD) did not produce better outcomes than treatment with Lucentis alone.

column4: Colombia's Cano pipeline  Occidental oilfield restart after attacks
column5: BOGOTA Occidental Petroleum Corp has restarted crude production at Colombia's Cano Limon oilfield and its pipeline is pumping again after a series of rebel attacks shut output and transport for several weeks  the military said on Monday.

column4: PetroChina wins U.S. crude tender to sell to PDVSA: traders
column5: HOUSTON China's trading firm PetroChina was awarded a tender to sell up to 1.65 million barrels of U.S. light crude to Venezuela's state-run PDVSA for delivery in the coming weeks at a terminal in Curacao  traders said on Monday.

column4: Brazil's latest political risks tolerable for bargain-hunting investors
column5: A 5 percent drop in Brazil's real currency and similar decline in the Bovespa stock index  since Donald Trump's surprise victory in last month's U.S. presidential election have created a buying opportunity in some Brazilian assets  say a number of emerging market fund managers.

column4: Exclusive: California to probe sale of Prudential insurance through Wells Fargo
column5: NEW YORK The state of California has ordered an investigation into allegations Wells Fargo  retail bankers signed up customers for life insurance policies from Prudential Financial  without their permission.

column4: Exclusive: California to probe sale of Prudential insurance through Wells Fargo
column5: NEW YORK The state of California has ordered an investigation into allegations Wells Fargo  retail bankers signed up customers for life insurance policies from Prudential Financial  without their permission.

column4: Exclusive: California to probe sale of Prudential insurance through Wells Fargo
column5: NEW YORK The state of California has ordered an investigation into allegations Wells Fargo  retail bankers signed up customers for life insurance policies from Prudential Financial  without their permission.

column4: Exclusive: California to probe sale of Prudential insurance through Wells Fargo
column5: NEW YORK The state of California has ordered an investigation into allegations Wells Fargo  retail bankers signed up customers for life insurance policies from Prudential Financial  without their permission.

column4: Rio Tinto to defend itself if BSGR pursues action over Guinea
column5: LONDON Rio Tinto said on Monday it would defend itself robustly if rival miner BSG Resources (BSGR) pursues a threat to file a law suit over mining rights in Guinea.

column4: Morgan Stanley opens book for Tata Motors' shares worth up to $371 million: termsheet

column4: Imaging sensor maker E2V Tech agrees to $780 million offer from Teledyne
column5: British imaging sensor maker E2V Technologies Plc said on Monday it had agreed to an all-cash takeover offer worth about 620 million pounds (around $780 million) from Teledyne Technologies Inc.

column4: TreeHouse Foods recalls some products citing salmonella risk
column5: NEW YORK Packaged foods maker TreeHouse Foods Inc on Sunday recalled certain macaroni and cheese cup products containing cheddar cheese seasoning  saying they may be contaminated with salmonella.

column4: Exclusive: California to probe sale of Prudential insurance through Wells Fargo
column5: NEW YORK The state of California has ordered an investigation into allegations Wells Fargo  retail bankers signed up customers for life insurance policies from Prudential Financial  without their permission.
